com.bigdata.util.concurrent

Class ShutdownHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.bigdata.util.concurrent.ShutdownHelper

  • public class ShutdownHelper
extends Object
    Helper class for normal shutdown of an ExecutorService.
    Version:
    $Id$
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson

      • log

        protected static final org.apache.log4j.Logger log

    • Constructor Detail

      • ShutdownHelper

        public ShutdownHelper(ExecutorService executorService)
               throws InterruptedException
        Issues the ExecutorService.shutdown() request and then waits until all tasks running on that service have terminated.

        If the caller's Thread is interrupted while awaiting service termination, then the caller is responsible for the subsequent behavior. Common actions include continuing to await shutdown of the service, e.g., by invoking this method again, immediately terminating the service, etc.

        Parameters:
        executorService - The service to be shutdown.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - If interrupted while awaiting termination of the service.

      • ShutdownHelper

        public ShutdownHelper(ExecutorService executorService,
              long logTimeout,
              TimeUnit unit)
               throws InterruptedException
        Issues the ExecutorService.shutdown() request and then waits until all tasks running on that service have terminated.

        If the caller's Thread is interrupted while awaiting service termination, then the caller is responsible for the subsequent behavior. Common actions include continuing to await shutdown of the service, e.g., by invoking this method again, immediately terminating the service, etc.

        Parameters:
        executorService - The service to be shutdown.
        logTimeout - The timeout between #logTimeout(ExecutorService, long, Logger) notifications.
        unit - The unit in which that timeout is expressed.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if executorService is null.
        IllegalArgumentException - if logTimeout is non-positive.
        IllegalArgumentException - if unit is null.
        InterruptedException - If interrupted while awaiting termination of the service.

    • Method Detail

      • elapsed

        public long elapsed()
        The elapsed nanoseconds since the ExecutorService.shutdown() was initiated. This value is updated every 100ms until the service is terminated.

      • logTimeout

        protected void logTimeout()
        Invoked each time the logTimeout expires awaiting the service termination. The default implementation is a NOP, but it may be overriden in order to log a message, etc.
